result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlo P Quesada

records.addlTxt:
3:31 PM; Case called for Pretrial conference. Defendant Carlo P Quesada in court.  Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court for Carlo P Quesada.  Prosecuting attorney Jayne Davis Dewire in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Kershek provides an update; he advises the State needs time to see if there is any restitution owed.  Atty. Kershek requests a projected plea and sentencing date before the Judge assigned to the case.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing before the Judge assigned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Barnes & Noble/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

ADDRESS INFO for Carlo P Quesada
Current: 6627 Greenway Apt 1, Greendale, WI 53129   (Effective: 08-04-2022)
Prior: 6627 Greenway Apt 1, Greendale, WI 53129

Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022. (BC)

LF 8/8--mailed copy of signed Order to defendant.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 10:26 AM Defendant Carlo P Quesada in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing September 1, 2022.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 07/20/2022.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
